titleInfo.title: Developing and maintaining practical archives : a how-to-do-it manual
How-to-do-it manuals for libraries ;; no. 122; Variation: How-to-do-it manuals for libraries ;; no. 122.

mods.abstract: Abstract: Provides an introduction to archives and manuscripts and explains to librarians how to conduct a survey, start an archives program, and handle selection and appraisal, acquisitions and accessioning, arrangement, description, preservation, security and disaster planning, electronic records, and access, reference, and outreach. Contents: Ch. 1. Introduction to archives and manuscripts -- Ch. 2. Conducting a survey and starting an archival program -- Ch. 3. Selection and appraisal -- Ch. 4. Acquisitions and accessioning -- Ch. 5. Arrangement -- Ch. 6. Description -- Ch. 7. Preservation -- Ch. 8. Security and disaster planning -- Ch. 9. Access, reference, and outreach -- Ch. 10. Digital records -- Ch. 11. Audiovisual archives -- Ch. 12. Management -- Ch. 13. Archival profession -- App. A. North Fork University: institutional background -- App. B. Code of ethics for archivists -- App. C. Academy of Certified Archivists: role delineation statement for professional archivists.
